explanation: The report is correct. In the default case the statement "return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;" unconditionally exits the function, so the following "break;" can never be reached. That is dead/unreachable source code, which is exactly what MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 forbids. The presence or absence of the AF_INET6 conditional does not affect this — the break after the return is always unreachable. Recommended fix: remove the redundant "break;" (or restructure the control flow) so no unreachable statement remains.
